column5: crown,black label
Try the WR double oaked if you get the chance
A tall glass of well water on the rocks, especially after a hot day on the lake. After dinner a vodka and cranberry or two or three
How do you think they pay for medical costs? Alcohol and tobacco taxes pay for a chunk of it.
Ice cold beer. many ice cold beer's. Preferably Canadian or Blue.
In Canada it's Weisers and Dr Pepper, at home it's Makers Mark and Dr. Pepper.
A good cigar with an Alexander's Keith's Pale Ale finished off with a Bourbon over ice. Maybe another cigar .

I seem to take in about 25 cigars just for myself on every week-long trip. I always come back with several, so maybe I'll only figure on 20 this year. I may just take in some bourbon since I've developed much more of a palate for it.
#1. Brookers Gin on the "Rocks" with: #2. Diet Schweppes #3. Squirt of lime juice
I will help you out - I will send you my mailing address (especially if you buy good Cubans).....
Another vote for Crown & Coke here. In Canada, I found this Mill Street Tankhouse Ale to be dang good! 360 Pale Ale too.
lemon-lime gatoraide for this ole geezzzer
I'm a big fan of cold beers at the end of a day fishing but I have started moving over to the white claw seltzer, light and fresh after the beer start getting heavy.
Man - I have a hard time narrowing it down Mid day - I really like a Steigel Radler or a Muskoka Lager Night time I love rye (Forty Creek) and diet coke but wont do it without a lot of ice!
Beer
WELLLL - I will certainly agree with you on the "good cigar" (as that is always part of our routine also). Very relaxing after a "tough" day of fishing/catching......

I have recently started to only drink Guinness as my alcohol beverage of choice, it also goes perfectly with daily fish frys, and surprisingly it's pretty lite for a dark beer. I have also found the beer store in thunder bay has it cheaper than what I get it for south of the border, ofcourse exchange rates help.
I'm a blue guy during the day. Love a nice Crown with a splash of ginger ale in the evenings.
I’d love to take Guinness cans on my fly-ins, but you really need to drink it out of a pint glass. I suppose I could take one pint glass and wrap it up in my clothes to protect it from breaking.
Surprised nobody posting on bringing some Schmitt’s Gay to the party?
Busch light and a bloody Mary. We get something Canadian when we run out from the general store. The store is about two miles away.
Evan Williams for me please!
What always amazes me is the high cost of beer in Canada. A case of Canadian beer, such as Molson's or Labatt, is more expensive in Canada than in the U.S.
If you're only using for a trip like this, you will clear it in 3-4 days. Plan your smoking and return back accordingly.

Not being a smart*** but isn't that a cloudy? Harking back to my bartending days 45 years ago a press was 1/2 water and 1/2 7up, water press with a splash of 7up and cloudy and splash of coke or Pepsi. All good no matter what. wmd
For us it's Basil Hayden and Budweiser. Gotta keep a clear mind as the card game can get pretty serious!!

[QUOTE=wmd;6399206][QUOTE=PRO-V16;6395924]Pendleton whiskey press with a splash of Pepsi.[/QUOTENot being a smart*** but isn't that a cloudy? Harking back to my bartending days 45 years ago a press was 1/2 water and 1/2 7up, water press with a splash of 7up and cloudy and splash of coke or Pepsi.All good no matter what.wmd[/QUOTEWe always called it a cloudy too but after seeing another poster refer to a press I thought we were calling it the wrong name.🙄 Not a bartender and I've been drinking the same thing mostly for 40 years. Thanks for straightening me out.
WMD -As long as I have been drinking ----- I agree with you on the definition of a "press"....................
when I learned to tend Bar 45 years ago.....A "pres" was half sweet and half club soda. Pres was actually short for Presbyterian I was told

For several years the LCBO at Red Lake carried Bell's Scotch. As a proud Bell myself I had to try it. Not bad, similar to Dewars White Label. Became a tradition for several years until they quit stocking it.
For me, a nice bourbon such as Knob's Creek with a splash of water.
Growing up, my Mom always drank Bourbon (or Brandy) Press's. Couple shots of bourbon, and half seltzer, half sweet. I have a friend who always drinks VO Press's.
Smoky scotch and a good cigar!

A long time ago I lived in Puerto Rico for two years and grew fond of Rum. Still my drink of choice the few times I drink these days.Cold beer goes down well with a good pizza or Mexican food.Overdid the Crown/Coke forty years ago and still can't look at that combo.... I was a couple days getting healed up from that night.Not a weed guy.Pooch

Bawahahahaha!!!!! Found this stuff at the LCBO in Wawa Ontario last year. Didn't buy any but always wondered what Juicy A** tasted like........I guess I really didn't want to know. I stick to my old go to beer ....Canadian ....when in Canada. PjShorthorn
Crown and ginger, and, for my next trip in June, a nice joint on the side. Thanks Canada!
You guys with the "weed" must not have to take "P" tests at your place of work....LOL
Well, I don't wait until the end of the dayAny good cold Pilsner such as Blue or Yuengling® Golden Pilsner works for me.A couple of pulls on Jim Beam Black (12yr) is icing on the cake. Just sayin' FT
x2 on the 7 and 7 (or 7 and Diet Coke)
Rye whiskey and water light on the water if going to bar/restaurant Old Fashion
Pendleton whiskey press with a splash of Pepsi.
Brandy godfather 2 shots of good brandy, 1 shot of amaretto
The Two Hearted is outstanding stuff. But when in Canada, I do as Canadians do and drink Labatts.
A good IPA like a Bell's Two Hearted or a Manhattan made with Buffalo Trace bourbon.

Somehow this became a tradition when we finish fishing on my boat. After the fish are cleaned and the boat cleaned up and covered the guys walk into my sunroom and everyone has a Vodka, Tonic, and a splash of Orange Juice, more than one when it's really hot outside. Great summertime drink but for some reason the guys even want it when it's really chilly outside.
An ice cold Moosehead Lager!

After fishing....an ice cold beer . Then appetizers are prepared and everyone has either a Stoli on the rocks or a Saphire on the rocks with jalapeno olives....Possibly a second before dinner if supplies allow.
Every day favorites are Bulliet Rye and Yuengling Black & Tans. That being said, I’ll gladly drink any fancy stuff you put in front of me.
Heading to the local gin mill now for a $.050 draft. This workweek is over.. Happy Friday!
Budweiser and Vodka Red Bulls. You dudes hitting shots of Fireball? Nothing good happens after shots of Fireball.

We get the afternoon on the water when we arrive. When we're back at the cabin. It has become tradition upon arrival that after we prep the boat for the next day, three, or possibly 4, fingers of bourbon, two ice cubes, and a toast by name to friends gone, by name from each of us, a moment of silence, and down the hatch. After that, make dinner, and share the bounty of the water and the benefits of friends with different tastes in beer and bourbon, and possibly a Bloody Mary or two, depending on the mood for the evening.
**** I don't drink but I'm getting darn thirsty reading these and a little light headed

Crown and Coke is my go to, icecold Modelo in the cooler, if we're shooting tequila, its Don Julio 1942, always have Jack single barrel around and if I want a refreshing drink, I'm making a Pimms and ginger ale with a slice of cucumber.
3 fingers of Old Number 7 with a Kokanee wash!!!
Flying Monkeys Brewery's "Juicy ***" Double IPA
Wiser"s and water wmd

Cold beer, 7 & 7, CC & 7, Captain & Diet. We even partake in some "Nancy Pants" drinks like Vanilla Vodka, Diet Cherry Coke!!!A little fireball or peppermint schnapps during cool downs (to warm us up).LOTS of Coffee and Baileys!!!Basically start at 7am and finish at 1am.
Special Old Rye Whisky and Diet Pepsi.
Crown apple and cranberrie or Tito's and cranberrie. And sometimes a few Kokanees.

Keep the cold beers flowing for me. Spotted Cow for me if they have em... In Canada, Lab Blue please.. Been known to have a shot or 10 after a few beers. Seem come up with bad ideas with the shots after a few cold ones. Canada in the boat. Water, Coke, Gatorade or Sweet Tea only. I'm not getting pinched or causing an accident because of it. I can wait till we are in for the day.
Woodford reserve on ice, but not to much ice. It just melts and ruins good bourbon!
Gin and tonic with ice from the lake I am fishing, nothing better.
A cold Kokanee or Blue with a few shots of Fireballl
Back in my pre Betty Ford days, I enjoyed a good Seagrams and 7 after a day on the lake. What is your favorite drink to celebrate a good day on the water. I pretty much stick to weed now
Labatt Blue, good bourbon, or cabernet sauvignon....not necessarily in that order!
Bleue
Bloody Mary. It's not even necessarily my favorite drink, but it's been going on so long now that it's a tradition.
Nice cold beer, and now that it's legal, a nice joint as well.
A Rusty Nail.

AHHH - After a hard day of fishing (catching) The FIRST one has to be a pretty strong Crown Royal "press" (a little 7-up and water)......... After that one - we just "back-off a little on the Crown Royal.............

I'm old school Wisconsin. Therefore a little Korbel Brandy in a glass says "it's time to relax" for me. If I'm out in a fancy backwoods supper club I'll let them put a little vermouth in, but generally it's just an ounce or two in a glass. Shape of the glass is not important. I have nothing against a cold beer but generally that says "let's get the work done", "let's play another 9", or "he got fouled!"
Depends on the day of the week.. We now have traditions like 'Tequila Tuesday".."Whiskey Wednesday" etc..
Crown Royal Black Label
